questions.text: Which among the following is most common neoplasm of salivary gland?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common salivary gland neoplasm is : Pleomorphic Adenoma Option B : Most common malignant tumour of minor salivary glands is Adenoid Cystic Neoplasm Option C: Most common malignant tumour of Salivary gland is Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma

choices.text: Superficial parotidectomy is the treatment of choice

questions.text: True about parotid tumor: (PGI 2010)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A, B & D) Option A is correct as Facial nerve involvement in parotid tumours indicate malignancy Option B is correct as Pleomorphic adenoma is most common variety of parotid tumour. Pleomorphic adenoma most commonly occurs in parotid gland but it can also occur in other salivary glands . Option C is false as most of parotid tumours are benign. Risk of malignancy in salivary gland tumours is inversely proportional to the size of salivary glands. As parotid is a larger salivary gland risk of a tumour occuring in it to be malignant is less. Option D is correct as most of parotid tumours originate from the superficial lobe so superficial parotidectomy is the treatment of choice .

questions.text: Exclusively found in parotid gland: (PGI May 2011)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A & B) Warthin's tumour and Acinic Cell Carcinoma are the ones which occur exclusively in Parotid Gland. Most common bilateral parotid tumor is Warthin's tumor Option C: Most common site of occurance of pleomorphic adenoma is parotid but pleomorphic adenoma can occur at other salivary gland tumours as well Option D: Most common site of occurrence of Adenoid Cystic Ca is minor salivary glands Option E: Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma is the most common malignant tumour of parotid .

questions.text: Hot spot on Tc-99 is seen in which parotid tumour? (JIPMER 2014, 2010; AIIMS May 2013)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) hot spots on Tc-99 scan is seen in Adenolymphoma which is also referred to as a warthin's tumour Options B,C and D : Adenoid cystic neoplasm, Acinic cell neoplasm and Adenocarcinoma of parotid do not show hot spot on Tc-99 scan.

questions.text: Tumor with perineural invasion:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Salivary gland tumour which has propensity for perineural invasion is Adenoid Cystic Neoplasm Option A,C and D : Adenocarcinoma, Basal Cell Ca and Squamous cell Ca of the salivary gland do not have a propensity for perineural invasion.

questions.text: Swelling of deep lobe of parotid gland presents as swelling in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) swelling of the deep lobe of parotid gland presents as a swelling in the parapharyngeal space. Option B: Swelling of the superficial lobe of the parotid presents as a swelling in the cheek Option C : Swelling in parotid gland never presents with a swelling above the zygomatic bone because of the capsular attachment to the zygomatic bone. Option D: Swelling in the parotid superficial lobe can present as a swelling below the ears and it pushes the ear up .

questions.text: Ramavati, a 40-years old female presented with a progressively increasing lump in the parotid region. On oral examination, the tonsil was pushed medially, Biopsy showed it to be pleomorphic adenoma. The appropriate treatment is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) In this clinical scenario there is a patient who has a parotid swelling which is pushing the tonsils medially, this signifies that swelling is in deep lobe of parotid. For this we need to remove the deep lobe and out of the surgeries mentioned above the one which removes the deep lobe is total conservative parotidectomy. Option A: As most of the pleomorphic adenomas only involve the superficial lobe they are treated by superficial parotidectomy Option B: Lumpectomy is not a treatment option for pleomorphic adenoma of parotid gland Option D: Enucleation is not a preferred treatment for pleomorphic adenoma as after this patient comes back with multicentric recurrence

questions.text: After removal of parotid gland, patient is having sweating on the cheeks while eating. In this complication seen after parotidectomy, the auriculotemporal nerve which contains parasympathetic secretomotor fibers to parotid gland is fused with which nerve? (AIIMS May 2012)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Cross innervation between somatic sensory supply (greater auricular)(superior cervical ganglion) and parasympathetic secretomotor fibers to the parotid is considered to be part of the anatomical basis for the phenomenon of gustatory sweating (Frey’s syndrome) seen after parotid surgery, when the nerve is at risk of injury. Option B: Facial nerve injury is one of the complication of parotid surgery but it does not lead to Frey's Syndrome Option D: Buccal nerve is the most commonly injured nerve in parotid surgeries

questions.text: The ‘Starch iodine test’ is useful to diagnose?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Starch iodine test is used for the diagnosis of Frey's Syndrome. You have to paint the area above the parotid with iodine and allow it to dry. Later we apply starch ove this skin and then ask patient to eat lemon for 5 minutes. Because of lemon there is parasympathetic stimulation and salivation occurs, If there is frey's syndrome it will lead to sweating as well . When sweat comes in contact with the starch in presence of iodine it leads to the dark blue black colour and this is starch iodine test.

choices.text: For treatment of recurrent chronic parotitis

questions.text: Newman and Seabrook’s operation is used for:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Newman and Seabrook's operation is used for the treatment of parotid fistula if there is a fistulous communication between the skin and the parotid duct. In this we go for the reconstruction of the parotid duct.

questions.text: The parotid duct is known as:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Name of Parotid duct is Stenson's Duct Option A: Duct of Submandibular gland is Wharton's duct Option C and D: Sublingual gland can either enter the buccal cavity as multiple small ducts, if this is the scenario these are called as Duct of Rivinus. If the sublingual gland forms one duct it is called Bartholins duct. Bartholin's duct joins the wharton's duct and opens with it.

questions.text: Nerve which lies in association to Wharton’s duct is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Lingual nerve lies in a close association with submandibular duct and most prone to damage during submandibular gland surgery. Most common Structure injured in Submandibular Stone surgeries is : Lingual Nerve

questions.text: Most common location of ectopic submandibular salivary gland tissue is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) MC ectopic salivary tissue is the Stafne bone cyst. This presents as an asymptomatic, clearly demarcated radiolucency of the angle of the mandible, characteristically below the inferior dental neurovascular bundle It is formed by invagination into the bone on the lingual aspect of the mandible of an ectopic lobe of the juxtaposed submandibular gland No treatment is required

questions.text: In submandibular gland surgery, the nerve least likely to be injured is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Inferior alveolar nerve is not related to submandibular salivary gland so it is not commonly injured in submandibular gland surgeries Option C: Lingual nerve hooks the Submandibular duct so it is the most common nerve to be injured while operating on submandibular duct . Option B and D : Hypoglossal nerve and Marginal mandibular nerve is also related to the submandibular gland so they can be injured in submandibular gland surgeries

questions.text: Which of the following is not a landmark for facial nerve during parotid surgery?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Landmarks for identification of Facial Nerve : Tympanomastoid suture line (most constant landmark) Tragal pointer Posterior belly of digastric Retromandibular vein Styloid process

questions.text: Ackerman’s tumour is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Ackerman's tumour is a distinct variant of well-differentiated SCC that may develop in any mucosal surface in the upper respiratory and digestive tract. It is also called as Verrucous Carcinoma.

questions.text: What is ranula?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Ranula is a Cystic Swelling occurring in the floor of the mouth and it is a type of extravasation cyst. Plunging Ranula is a retention cyst most commonly arising from the Sublingual gland

questions.text: Excision of ranula is associated with injury to:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Most common structure injured in operation for ranula is submandibular duct Most common nerve injured in operation for ranula is Lingual Nerve.

choices.text: 80% of stones occur in the submandibular gland
Majority of submandibular stones are radiolucent
Stones are the most common cause of obstruction within the submandibular gland
Patient presents with acute swelling in the region of the submandibular gland

questions.text: All of the following statement regarding stones in the submandibular gland are true except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is false as majority of the submandibular stones are radiopaque. 80% of submandibular gland stones are radiopaque. Option A: Most common location of salivary gland stones is submandibular gland. Most common composition is of Calcium phosphate . Option C: Stones are the most common cause of obstruction within the submandibular gland. Option D: Whenever the patient has a submandibular salivary duct stone, patient presents with postprandial swelling in the submandibular gland and postprandial pain.

choices.text: Simple enucleation is treatment of choice

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding malignant minor salivary gland tumours except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option D is wrong as we do not do simple enucleation for the treatment of salivary gland tumors. We have to go for excision with a margin. Option A: Minor salivary gland tumours are painful as they tend to involve the underlying structures. Option B: Minor salivary gland tumours may present as skin ulcerations. Option C: Minor salivary gland tumours have a propensity to spread via lymphatic route and may present as a lymphadenopathy.

questions.text: Which of the following is an indication of radiotherapy in pleomorphic adenoma of parotid?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Indications of radiotherapy in Salivary Gland Tumors : High grade tumors Large primary lesions Perineural invasion Bone invasion Cervical LN metastasis Positive surgical margins

questions.text: Swiss cheese pattern is seen in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Most common histological type of adenoid cystic Carcinoma is Cribriform variety. It shows a typical Swiss Cheese pattern. Option A : Warthin's tumour shows a hot scan on Tc99 Scan Option C: Pleomorphic Adenoma shows a typical pseudocapsule formation Option D: Mucoepidermoid carcinoma is the most malignant lesion of salivary glands

questions.text: Best diagnostic modality for parotid swelling is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) FNAC is the best diagnostic modality for the parotid swelling. Option A is a treatment option and not used for diagnosis. Enucleation is not preferred for pleomorphic adenoma as it causes recurrence Option C that is superficial parotidectomy is a treatment modality and not for diagnosis. Superficial parotidectomy is a treatment option for pleomorphic adenomas involving superficial lobe of the parotid. Option D Excisional biopsy is not preferred for salivary gland tumours as this leads to the formation of fistula and may seed the tract with malignant cells.

questions.text: Most common tumour of salivary gland in children is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common parotid tumour in children is Hemangioma Most common benign tumour of parotid in adults is Pleomorphic Adenoma Most common malignant tumour of minor salivary glands is adenoid cystic neoplasm Most common malignant tumour of salivary glands is mucoepidermoid carcinoma .

questions.text: Salivary gland tumour associated with EBV Infection is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Lymphoepithelioma or Eskimoma is the salivary gland tumour associated with EBV Infection Option B: Adenolymphoma or Warthin's tumour is associated with smoking Option C: Pleomorphic adenoma is associated with pseudocapsule Option D: Adenoid cystic neoplasm is a salivary gland tumors with perineural invasion

questions.text: After parotidectomy patients complaints of loss of sensation while shaving. Which nerve is most likely affected?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Nerves likely to be injured in case of parotid Surgery - 1. Facial nerve -patient presents with deviation of mouth, inability to close the eyes, inability to puff cheeks, tear from eyes on same side. 2. Greater auricular nerve-causes Loss of sensation while shaving as it supplies area near angle of mandible. 3. Auriculotemporal nerve -Patient presents with Frey's syndrome,also known as gustatory sweating.Patient presents with sweating & erythema in area of parotid.It occurs due to inappropriate regeneration of post ganglionic parasympathetic nerve fibers,which unite with the sympathetic fibers of the superior cervical ganglia,which is responsibie for sweating & erythema. Mandibular nerve is not injured in parotid surgeries.

questions.text: A patient after parotid surgery on awakening noticed lower lip paralysis. which of the following nerve is most likely injured
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Mandibular branch of facial nerve supplies lower lip,hence, lower lip paralysis will occur due to injury to this branch. Option B-Injury to Main trunk of facial nerve will cause ipsilateral hemiplegia of face. Option C-Parotid duct injury cannot cause paralysis of face. Option D-Temporal branch of facial nerve supplies upper part of face.
